intro: Barkhausia rubra, commonly known as the red bark orchid, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive red and orange-colored bark. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in spring, and it is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
